Is Gen Z really “unemployable”? Or are companies just stuck in the past?
The Wall Street Journal claims that only 2% of Gen Z value “achievement, learning, and work centrism” — basically the holy trinity of corporate worship. But when you actually listen to what Gen Z prioritizes — self-care, authenticity, and altruism — the story starts to sound a lot less like “lazy zoomers” and a lot more like a broken work system.

In this video, I break down the WSJ article, the LinkedIn meltdowns, and why older hiring managers keep
title: GEN-Z IS UNEMPLOYABLE?!
